kickstart.inventory

Class InventoryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • kickstart.inventory.InventoryManager

  • @Component
 @Transactional
public class InventoryManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages all aspects of the inventory/stock. It stores the amount and can change the amount by reorders to the stock or by orders of a customer.

      • addArticle

        public void addArticle(@NotNull
                       @NotNull Article newArticle)
        Parameters:

      • hasSufficientQuantity

        public boolean hasSufficientQuantity(@NotNull
                                     @NotNull Article article,
                                     @NotNull
                                     @NotNull org.salespointframework.quantity.Quantity quantity)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        article - The article whose amount should be checked.
        quantity - The desired quantity
        Returns:
        True, if the quantity in the inventory is greater or equal to the desired quantity. false if the article is not present or if the quantity in the inventory is less then the desired quantity
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If Quantity hasn't the Metric Metric.UNIT

      • reorder

        public void reorder(@NotNull
                    @NotNull Article article,
                    @NotNull
                    @NotNull org.salespointframework.quantity.Quantity quantity)
        Creates a new reorder for the article so that after the specified reorder time, the quantity increases. It also adds an AccountancyEntry to the AccountancyManager
        Parameters:
        article - The article that should get reordered.
        quantity - The desired quantity

      • reorder

        public void reorder(@NotNull
                    @NotNull org.salespointframework.catalog.ProductIdentifier id,
                    @NotNull
                    @NotNull org.salespointframework.quantity.Quantity quantity)
        Creates a new reorder for the article so that after the specified reorder time, the quantity increases. It also adds an AccountancyEntry to the AccountancyManager
        Parameters:
        id - The ProductIdentifier of the article that should get reordered.
        quantity - The desired quantity

      • decreaseQuantity

        public void decreaseQuantity(@NotNull
                             @NotNull Article article,
                             @NotNull
                             @NotNull org.salespointframework.quantity.Quantity quantity)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method decreases the amount of this article in process of e.g. an order.
        Parameters:
        article - The article whose amount should be decreased.
        quantity - The desired quantity
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If Quantity hasn't the Metric Metric.UNIT the article exists and if not add it with addArticle

      • isPresent

        public boolean isPresent(@NotNull

        Parameters:
        article -
        Returns:

      • isPresent

        public boolean isPresent(@NotNull
                         @NotNull org.salespointframework.catalog.ProductIdentifier id)
        Parameters:
        id - The ProductIdentifier of the asked id
        Returns:
        Returns if there exists an InventoryItem for this article. Otherwise false

      • update

        @Scheduled(fixedRate=5000L)
public void update()
        This functions runs the update method of the class ReorderableInventoryItem for all currently stored reorders. If update on a reorders returns true, the reorder is deleted from the repository.
